intro: Anthyllis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable anthyllis, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in early spring, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain its seeds. Anthyllis heterophylla is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
